articles.title: Bryson DeChambeau says he'd play golf with Kamala Harris or Obama

Bryson DeChambeau says that he's open to playing golf with anyone on the political spectrum after Donald Trump appeared on his YouTube channel.

The video, which has since done 6.6million views on the... [2531 symbols]
articles.summary: Bryson DeChambeau, a two-time US Open winner, has expressed his willingness to play golf with any influential political leaders, regardless of their political affiliation. This follows a video featuring former President Barack Obama and DeChAMbeau that has received over 6.6 million views on his YouTube channel. Speaking to media ahead of this weekend's LIV Golf event, he said that he was eager to play with anyone interested in doing so. He also expressed his desire to use golf to bring everyone together in a cool way, a key part of his strategy to inspire younger generations.

articles.title: Argentine President Milei travels to France to meet Macron after outcry over racist soccer chants
articles.description: Argentine President Javier Milei has arrived in Paris, where he is expected to meet French President Emmanuel Macron after tensions escalated between their countries over the Argentine soccer team’s derogatory post-match chants about French players.
articles.content: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina (AP) — arrived Thursday in Paris, his office said, where he is expected to meet French President after tensions escalated between their countries over the Argentine soccer team... [3531 symbols]
articles.summary: Argentina's President, Manuel Milei, is set to meet with French President, after tensions between their countries escalated over the Argentine soccer team's racist post-match chants about French players. The clip, which was captured during celebrations in Miami, shows players chanting a song considered racist towards French players of African heritage. French officials and the French soccer federation have condemned the chants. Argentina's conservative vice president, Victoria Villarruel, defended Fernandez and the team, stating that Argentina would not tolerate criticism from a "colonialist" country. Despite this, President Milei has been trying to balance nationalism with diplomatic backlash. In addition to meeting with French officials, Milei will attend the 2024 Olympic opening ceremony and hold talks with French business leaders.

articles.summary: BBC pundit and Olympian Paula Radcliffe has issued an apology following her wish for the 'best of luck' to Dutch beach volleyball player Steven Van de Velde, who was sentenced to four years in prison in 2016 for raping a 12-year-old British girl when he was 19. His inclusion in the Dutch team has led to increased security at the athletes' village. Radcliffe had previously wished him luck during a radio interview with LBC and stated that it was a tough thing to punish him twice. After widespread backlash, she posted an apology statement on social media.

The Crown Point sophomore said he has had a hard time reining it back in since then.

articles.summary: Crown Point sophomore Clinton Shepherd, a state runner-up, became a national champion of the 16U men’s freestyle champion at 132 pounds during USA Wrestling’�s national tournament in Fargo, North Dakota on July 17. She defeated California resident Ashton Besmer, who had previously beaten Shepherd 6-4 during the national duals. Shepherd credits his commitment to wrestling and willingness to seek out help from others to improve his wrestling. Despite initially weighing in at 0.4 pounds over the limit on the morning of the tournament, Shepherd's determination to succeed is a key part of his preparation for freestyle, which he prefers over folkstyle during the high school season.

He praised Woods as 'probably the most influential figure in the game of golf' and believes he deserves to play in the majors. This comes after retired player Colin Montgomerie suggested that Woods should retire due to his lack of performance at Royal Troon. Despite these setbacks, Woods remains optimistic about his game and health. He plans to return to competitive golf at the Hero World Challenge in December.

Despite multiple reports of ongoing issues between Sirinianni and Hurts. However, Hurts stated that they are on good terms and that he trusts his team's decision to lead them in the right direction. This comes after the Eagles lost six of their last seven games following a 10-1 start. With the addition of Kellen Moore as an offensive coordinator, Sirianini's role has slightly changed.

articles.title: Argentina soccer says its Olympic training base was robbed before chaotic game vs Morocco

Argentina men’s soccer coach said the team’s Olympic training base was robbed before its on Wednesday.

The Argentina delegation filed a police complaint in Lyon, the prosecutor’s office of nearby Sai... [1302 symbols]
articles.summary: Argentina's men's soccer coach, Mascherano, has reported that the team's Olympic training base was robbed before their game against Morocco. The Argentina delegation has filed a police complaint in Lyon and the prosecutor's office of Saint-Etienne has confirmed that the stolen items include midfielder Thiago Almada's watch. This comes amid a troubled start to the Olympics for Argentina, which was awarded gold in 2004 and 2008. The game was suspended for nearly two hours after Morocco fans threw bottles to protest a goal that appeared to be an equalizing goal in the 16th minute of added time. The goal was overturned after being reviewed by the video assistant referee (VAR).

But Januzaj, 29 failed to live up to the ... [1895 symbols]
articles.summary: Former Manchester United player, ADNAN JANUZAJ, has joined Las Palmas on loan for the season from Sevilla. The 29-year-old playmaker, who burst onto the scene as a teenager, failed to live up to expectations and embarked on a career that has now taken him to seven clubs. Fans were shocked to see him join the LaLiga minnows, with some expressing concern over his decline. Januzaj made his debut for Manchester United in the 2013 Community Shield and scored five goals and eight assists that hinted at plenty more to come.

articles.summary: Kait Flynn, an NHL fan, flashed her chest during an Edmonton Oilers playoff game in June, making her a viral social media talking point. The footage was shared online and Flynn became known as "The Oilers Girl" after she celebrated her team's win by lifting her top during Game 5 of the NHL Conference Finals against the Dallas Stars. While the team was defeated 2-1 by the Florida Panthers in June 25's Stanley Cup Final, Flynn gained widespread notoriety and signed a deal with Playboy. She made an appearance on the podcast Off the Vine with Kaitlyn Bristowe to discuss her mother's reaction to the viral moment.

Head coach Sean McVay praised the secondary's "sticky coverage" during their first training camp practice.

The 38-year-old left-arm seamer will be available for Durham's final five County Championship matches and the remainder of the One-Day Cup. North believes Wagner's experience will enhance Durham's bowling attack and add a further competitive edge to their team.

articles.title: As Paris Games cheer gender equity, female Paralympians face 'double marginalisation'
articles.description: As organisers and fans celebrate the start of the first "gender-equal Games" this month in Paris, Paralympic athletes still face multiple barriers to achieving the feminist dream, experts say.
articles.content: PARIS, July 25 (Reuters) - As organisers and fans celebrate the start of the first "gender-equal Games" this month in Paris, Paralympic athletes still face multiple barriers to achieving the feminist ... [2487 symbols]
articles.summary: As the Paris Games celebrate the start of the first "gender-equal Games" in Paris, female Paralympians are still being marginalised, according to experts. The 2024 Olympics will mark a significant milestone with equal numbers of spots allocated to female and male athletes for the first time. Retired Paralympian Alana Nichols, a three-time gold medallist, said not enough women and girls were entering the para-sport pipeline to achieve equal participation. The International Paralympic Committee (IPC) expects about a 55% to 45% split between male and female competitors in Paris. Craig Spence, the IPC's chief brand and communications officer, said there will be 1,860 female slots for the Paris Paralympics, a significant improvement from the 990 available at the 2000 Sydney Games.

articles.title: Ten players to define Olympic football at Paris 2024

articles.summary: The official opening ceremony for the Paris 2024 Olympics is set to take place on Friday, with football in both men's and women's events. While the women's event is a senior competition, men's teams are generally an under-23 event with up to three overage exceptions per squad. Players such as Colombian forward Caicedo, who starred at the World Cup last year, and Real Madrid, are expected to be a standout. Brazilian legend Marta, six-time World Player of the Year, will play at her sixth Olympic Games and will set a new record if she scores at them. Other notable players include Man City's Alvarez, Spain's Bonmati, and Man City’s Alvarez.

articles.title: US figure skaters set to get team gold medals at Paris Olympics after ruling in 2022 doping case
articles.description: LAUSANNE, Switzerland (AP) — The United States figure skating team was formally confirmed as gold medalists from the 2022 Olympics by a sports court ruling Thursday, opening the way for the team to get their medals at the Paris Summer Games.
articles.content: Special medal ceremonies are planned by the IOC in the second week of the Paris Olympics to honor athletes whose results have been upgraded because of doping cases that were prosecuted and resolved in... [917 symbols]
articles.summary: US figure skaters are set to receive team gold medals at the Paris Olympics after a doping ruling in 2022. Special medal ceremonies will be held for athletes whose results have been upgraded due to doping cases. Russian athlete, Valieva, was disqualified after a positive doping test was revealed on the day of the team event. The U.S. and Japan placed second and third respectively in the revised result. The Canadian team is awaiting a verdict in a separate appeal to be upgraded from fourth to third, knocking Russia off the podium.

articles.title: Tom Daley hoping he can deny China a clean sweep of diving golds again
articles.description: Daley will partner Noah Williams in Paris in defence of his men’s synchronisd 10 metre platform.
articles.content:
Tom Daley is out to dash China’s bid for a clean sweep of Olympic gold medals in diving once again.

Daley ended a 13-year wait for Olympic glory at the delayed Tokyo Games three years ago as he and M... [2971 symbols]
articles.summary: Tom Daley is aiming to deny China a clean sweep of Olympic gold medals in diving again, following his 13-year wait for Olympic glory at the Tokyo Games. Daley and Matty Lee won the men’s synchronised 10m platform at the delayed Tokyo Games three years ago, beating China by a narrow 1.23 points. This time, he will partner Noah Williams in the defending of his title. Despite acknowledging that China will be favourites for the gold, Daley believes the format of the matches brings other nations into consideration. He has been named as Team GB's joint flag bearer for the opening ceremony alongside rower Helen Glover.

articles.title: The viral Starbucks x Stanley Cup has just launched in the UK: Here’s how to get one

The Starbu... [3404 symbols]
articles.summary: The Starbucks x Stanley Cup has just launched in the UK, with a collaboration with Starbucks to create a limited-edition version of the iconic Stanley quencher. The iconic insulated cup, which holds over a litre of liquid and is made of 90 per cent recycled stainless steel, can only be purchased in-store and requires a Starbucks rewards member to have access to the collaboration. However, once these sky-blue beauties are gone, they will only be available while stocks last. The process involves downloading the Starbucks UK app and purchasing the cup from a Starbucks store or via the Google Play store, using the app to access access. Other versions of the viral Stanley Cups are also available for purchase in the US.

articles.title: Team GB archer Megan Havers fires first shot as South Korea target world records
articles.description: Havers and GB teammates Bryony Pitman & Penny Healey are seeded 11th following the Women’s Archery individual rankings round in Paris
articles.content:
In the shadow of Napoleon’s tomb, a 16-year-old from Leicester became the first Team GB athlete to compete at Paris 2024.

Megan Havers, who attended her school prom just a few weeks ago, fired the fi... [3545 symbols]
articles.summary: Megan Havers, a 16-year-old British archer, became the first Team GB athlete to compete in Paris 2024. She fired the first shot in the women’s archery ranking round, marking the passing of the baton from the London 2012 generation. The first world record fell at the hands of Korean Lim Sihyeon, who shot 694 to surpass his compatriot Kang Chae Young’�s previous mark of 692 set in 2019. The ranking round is a curiosity of the Olympic Games and involves all 128 archers shooting 72 arrows each on the same field, with total scores producing seedings for individual and team competition. Tokyo Olympian Bryony Pitman finished 41st, Havers 49th and Penny Healey 52nd, with Team GB seeded 11th for the women's team event.

articles.title: Josh Kerr: The 1,500m star looking to take down Olympic champion Jakob Ingebrigtsen

Confident, explosive, a world champion: Josh Kerr is undoubtedly one of the British athletes to watch at this summer’s Olympics in Paris.

Kerr’s fierce rivalry with Olympic Jakob Ingebrigtsen is one ... [2949 symbols]
articles.summary: British athlete Josh Kerr is set to compete in the 1,500m race against Olympic champion Jakob Ingebrigtsen at the Olympics in Paris. Kerr, who became world champion at the World Championships last year, has been building on his confidence after smashing Steve Cram's 39-year-old British record in the mile race. Despite missing out on the BBC Sports Personality of the Year awards last year due to a perceived snub, Kerr plans to use this as motivation ahead of the Olympics. He also expressed his desire to win gold at the Games.

articles.summary: Graeme Souness has reignited his feud with Manchester United captain Bruno Fernandes, accusing him of having a passive attitude towards the team. This follows a disagreement over a moment he did not like from Fernandes during a match two seasons ago, when he was the captain. Sousess argued that Fernandes should have been one of the last ones to go up during a crucial match against Liverpool. He also stated that leaders in the modern game tend to hide and avoid accountability. Fernandes has faced criticism throughout his time at United for his on-field actions, but has had success at the club since taking over the captaincy from Harry Maguire.

articles.title: Mille Lacs walleye anglers can start keeping fish Aug. 16
articles.description: With ample capacity left in the state’s harvest quota, there’s hope DNR will loosen regulations beyond the one-fish bag limit set prior to the season.
articles.content:
There is hope around Mille Lacs Lake for a loosening of walleye regulations next month beyond the slot-restricted, one-fish bag limit set to open Aug. 16.

According to Minnesota State Fisheries Chief... [3702 symbols]
articles.summary: There is hope that the Department of Natural Resources (DNR) will loosen walleye regulations on Mille Lacs Lake beyond the one-fish bag limit set to open on Aug. 16. The Department ofNatural Resources (Mille Lac) has reported low walleyer mortality on the lake since the opening of the season began on May 11. The current bag limit allows anglers to keep one walleyed, 21-to-23 inches, starting Aug.16. However, there is speculation that the DNR may extend the bag limit to two walleyes or combine the two-inch harvest slot. The announcement could come as early as Monday evening when DNR fisheries biologists meet with the Mille-Lacs Fisheries Advisory Committee.

articles.summary: The Court of Arbitration for Sport has reinstated the United States figure skating team from the 2022 Olympics, allowing them to receive their team gold medals at the Paris Olympics. The decision comes after the team event gold medalist, Kamila Valieva, was disqualified and banned in a doping case in January. The CAS has dismissed Russian appeals to be reinstated. This ruling guarantees the U.S. team gold in an event where no medals were presented in 2022. Special medal ceremonies are planned for the Paris Games due to upgraded results due to doping cases.

articles.title: N.J. baseball Player of the Year Luke Dickerson signs record contract with Nationals
articles.description: Luke Dickerson, the 44th overall pick, signed for $3.8 million, the most ever in the bonus pool era of the MLB Draft for someone drafted outside the 1st round
articles.content: Over a week after Dickerson — the NJ.com Player of the Year — was drafted in the second round, 44th overall by the Washington Nationals in the 2024 MLB Draft, Dickerson has signed a record-breaking co... [2101 symbols]
articles.summary: N.J. baseball Player of the Year, Luke Dickerson, has signed a record-breaking contract with the Washington Nationals for $3.8 million, the highest-ever in the bonus pool era for a player drafted outside of the first round and the supplemental first round. Dickerson was drafted in the second round, 44th overall by the Nationals in the 2024 MLB Draft and signed for $1.7 million above his slot value of $2,122,200. The contract is the most-ever for a drafted outside the first and supplemental first-round period for a non-first-round player, according to MLB.com’s Jim Callis. The old record second-round pool record was $33.5 million, which the Philadelphia Phillies gave Kevin Gowdy in 2016. Dickenson, a shortstop, hit 18 home runs and was named NJ.com Player of Year after helping Morris Knolls win its second consecutive Group 3 championship and stealing 27 bases.

articles.summary: The Olympic football team has a history of controversy and controversy at the Games, starting with an "unofficial" final between Denmark and Greece in 1896, where the referee, Prince George, was a royal in both nations. The North Korean women's team nearly didn't play at all in 2012 due to a mix-up of screens displaying the South Korean flag by mistake before their match against Colombia. In 2016, USA USA USA goalkeeper Hope Solo labelled Sweden "a bunch of cowards" for their team's actions in a penalty shootout. The men’s event kicked off amid tight security as Israel faced Mali in Paris, but Argentina and Morocco had different ideas, with Argentina’ Cristian Medina scoring one of the greatest last-minute pinball equalisers ever seen. The game was suspended after full-time was played for three minutes, leading to a pitch invasion and three more minutes of additional time. The women's event will begin later on Thursday as Canada will face New Zealand.

articles.summary: India's athletes are being told that sufficient sleep could be the foundation for Olympic success. Sleep therapist Monika Sharma has been appointed to keep them at their sharpest in Paris. She believes that optimised sleep can significantly improve athletes' performance, including their reaction time, accuracy, and immunity. She also aids in memory consolidation and emotional regulation. The Indian Olympic Association has organised three sleep pods at the Athletes Village to supplement their sleep.

One of the athletes will be the first U.S. men's basketball player to carry the American flag during the opening ceremony, alongside Coco Gauff, the first American tennis player to do so. The Paris Games will begin on July 26 and last until Sunday, Aug. 11.

articles.title: Yoshihiro Uchida, a Father of American Judo, Dies at 104
articles.description: Uchida was instrumental in making judo a popular competitive sport and, eventually, part of the Olympics.
articles.content: When Yoshihiro Uchida returned to San Jose, Calif., after World War II, he was discouraged to find employers turning away Japanese-Americans—even Japanese-American veterans, like him. Eventually, he t... [898 symbols]
articles.summary: Yoshihiro Uchida, the father of American Judo, has passed away at the age of 104. After World War II, Yoshihiro was discouraged from finding employment for Japanese-Americans, even Japanese-American veterans, due to discrimination against them. Eventually, he took the only job offered to him, teaching judo part-time at San Jose State University, where he resumed his education. His first judo students were students who were training to be police officers.

articles.title: Israel Warns That 'Iranian Terrorist Proxies' Plotting Attack On Israelis At Olympics

Israel Warns That 'Iranian Terrorist Proxies' Plotting Attack On Israelis At Olympics

            The 2024 Paris Olympics will officially open on the night of Friday, July 26 - but already there are ... [3344 symbols]
articles.summary: Israel has warned that Iranian terrorists are planning an attack on Israelis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Israeli Foreign Minister Israel Katz has informed his French counterpart, Stéphane Séjourné, of an alleged Iranian-backed plot to attack the Israeli delegation of athletes. Despite acknowledging the "unprecedented security measures" in place by French security forces to protect Israelis attending the games, Katz also noted that French authorities have rejected calls from the Left to ban all Israeli participants from the Olympics. There are currently 88 Israeli athletes at the games and they have been given unprecedented protection from both French and Israeli security services. However, there is no evidence linking the alleged attack to the Paris Olympics yet.

articles.summary: The Fire Inside, a true story about boxer and mixed martial artist Claressa Shields, has been brought to life through Ryan Destiny and Brian Tyree Henry. The film, directed by Oscar-winning screenwriter Barry Jenkins, depicts Shields as a high schooler before she became the first American woman to win an Olympic gold medal in boxing and has since gone on to win all 14 of her career professional boxing matches. The movie will premiere at the Toronto International Film Festival in September and will be released in theaters Dec. 25.

articles.title: Team of 20 Para athletics competitors nominated to Paris 2024 Canadian Paralympic Team

articles.summary: A team of 20 athletes has been nominated to represent Canada in the Paris 2024 Paralympic Games. The team includes five Paralympian medallists, led by Brent Lakatos, who has won 11 medals over his first five games. Two of these athletes are defending champions, aiming to repeat their success three years ago. Other athletes include Nate Riech, a two-time world champion in the men's T37/38 1,500 metres, and Zach Gingras, who earned his nomination with a silver medal at the 2023 World Para Athletics Championships and a successful performance at the 2024 Bell Track & Field Trials. There will also be 11 athletes making their Paralympics debuts.

The tournament will be held at Pleasant Valley Country Club in Little Rock, Arkansas, with a 54-player field competing for $2.3 million in prize money. Tickets include a $30 daily general admission ticket, children ages 15 and under being provided free general admission with a ticketed adult, and an upgraded 16 green hospitality ticket for $125 per day. Corporate sponsorships and hospitality packages are also available for purchase. Net proceeds from the tournament will benefit several nonprofit organizations in Arkansas.

articles.title: West Indies Can’t Stand The Test Of Time In Series Against England

articles.summary: The West Indies cricket team is struggling, with five-day games becoming increasingly shorter. The team's performance has been inconsistent, with Shoaib Bashir's innings leading the way for England. The final Test between the two teams is set to take place at Edgbaston, with the potential for another truncated game. This is not the first time England has defeated West Indies in a Test match in 31 years. Despite these setbacks, the West Indies' top order is learning, with only 17 Tests between them and their veterans, Jason Holder and Shamar Joseph. The decline in standards for the Caribbean team has been attributed to athletics and new sports, structural issues, and franchise franchise issues.

articles.title: Warner Bros. stock falls after losing 'key' NBA rights as league secures $77 billion deal with Disney, Comcast, and Amazon

articles.summary: Warner Bros. (Discovery) has lost a key media rights deal with the NBA, sending its shares down about 7% in early trading. The loss comes as the league secured a $77 billion deal with Disney, Comcast, and Amazon. Warner Bros. has been broadcasting NBA games on its TNT network since 1989 and reportedly pays $1.2 billion annually for the rights. This loss will impact TNT's NBA-adjacent content, such as "Inside the NBA." Warner Bros.'s statement stated that it had matched Amazon's media rights bid to continue airing NBA games, but the league rejected the offer. The company plans to sue the NBA for violating its contractual rights to air NBA games.

articles.title: Paris 2024 fans cannot drink alcoholic beer inside Olympic venues – but VIPs can
articles.description: Organisers tell Telegraph Sport they ‘did not ask for an exemption’ to ensure those in the cheaper seats could also enjoy a drink
articles.content:
In the city of fine wine and high dining, the alcohol runs dry inside Olympics venues as French laws force spectators to settle for €8 non-alcoholic beers.

Only arrivals lucky enough to enjoy VIP hos... [1938 symbols]
articles.summary: French laws prevent spectators from drinking alcoholic beer inside Olympic venues, forcing them to settle for €8 non-alcoholic beers. VIPs at Paris 2024, however, can enjoy alcohol under restrictions limiting alcohol sales at stadiums unless they accompany a meal. The law allows for an exemption from the sale of alcohol for 10 events per organiser per municipality per municipality, and Paris 2024 will host over 700 sessions over 15 days of competition. Local legislation passed in 1991 effectively prevents stadiums from selling alcoholic drinks without a meal, allowing VIPs to enjoy at least a glass or two. However, other fans will have to settle with 500ml of alcohol-free Kronenbourg 1664 for £6.73 (€8), or 400ml of Tourtel Twist’s alcohol-less beer with a twist of lemon for £5.01 (€6). Soft drinks are priced at £4.20 (€5) and water is £2.94 (€3.50) at events. The rule comes after the European Championship in Germany saw low-alcohol beers served at the England vs Serbia game in Gelsenkirchen.

articles.title: The Real Monetary Value Of The Paris 2024 Olympics Gold Medal
articles.description: It is possibly the highest value of any gold medal in the history of the modern games, primarily because of the record high prices for gold
articles.content: The opening ceremony of the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics on Friday marks the start of what is officially called the Games of the XXXIII Olympiad Paris. Approximately 10,500 athletes will participate acr... [6236 symbols]
articles.summary: The opening ceremony of the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics marks the start of the Games of the XXXIII Olympiad Paris. Approximately 10,500 athletes will compete in 32 sports in 329 medal events, with the gold medal being the ultimate prize. The materials used for the gold, silver, and bronze medals can significantly increase their value based on the record high prices for gold. The Olympic gold medal is approximately $950 based on its use, with over 95.4% of the medal being made of silver (505 grams). Six grams of pure gold, which serves as the plating for the medal, and 18 grams of iron, are reportedly valued at approximately $41,161.50. The bronze medal, which also incorporates elements from the Eiffel Tower, is approximately approximately $486.

articles.title: Equestrian federation chief confident sport will be in LA28 and Brisbane 32

articles.summary: The International Equestrian Federation (FEI) is confident that equestrian events will remain on the Olympic programme, despite several cases of horse abuse. The FEI recently suspended six-time Olympic medallist Charlotte Dujardin over her training methods, following a video showing a dressage rider whipping a horse's legs multiple times. Despite the outcry, FEI president Ingmar de Vos believes equestrians will still be included in the Los Angeles Games in 2028 and Brisbane in 2032. The federation has also released a plan with 37 measures to protect horses, including rules for the tightness of nosebands and flexible cross-country obstacles.

Tyson was a key member of Beast's team and was frequently attacked as a trans woman, despite her transition. This changed after Tyson was accused of exchanging inappropriate messages with minors, though the full scope of these allegations remains under investigation. Beast has issued his own statement, stating that he took immediate action to remove Tyson from the company, his channel, and any association with MrBeast, while Tyson stated that it was a mutually decided decision and that she would step away. McClaren, who previously worked as an assistant manager under Sir Alex Ferguson, will instead work with the players returning late to training following international commitments. The new role comes after the arrival of Ruud van Nistelrooy and Rene Hake as Erik ten Hag's new assistants. Meanwhile, McClaren remains at Carrington and is currently recovering from foot surgery. The team is set to play three matches during their tour, starting with a clash against Arsenal in Los Angeles on Saturday and ending with a Community Shield match against Manchester City on August 10.

articles.summary: Athletes have complained about food shortages at the Olympic Village in Paris after receiving promises of Michelin-star dishes. The amount of food available at the canteen is insufficient, according to reports from French newspaper L'Equipe. Eggs and grilled meats reportedly had to be rationed during the breakfast service. Sodexo Live!, the Olympic village's catering partner, confirmed that volumes will be increased to meet the athletes' needs. The Carrefour group, responsible for sourcing 600 tonnes of fresh produce for the Olympics, has also been requested to revise upwards the quantities initially planned. The food service is preparing to serve more than 13 million meals in the next month.

The 23-year-old's transfer would mark a significant turnaround in his career, which has been hampered by injury and limited playing time.

articles.summary: Australian rower Jean Mitchell, a 24-year-old Victorian, has beaten brain cancer to compete in the Olympics in Paris. She is part of the women's four in Paris, aiming to replicate the gold medal they achieved at the last Games in Tokyo. Mitchell, who underwent surgery at 16 and underwent radiation and chemotherapy, was off the water for two years before returning to training. She still has issues with her balance, hearing and tiredness and requires six-monthly MRI scans to ensure the cancer hasn't returned. Her teammates, Lily Alton, Olympia Aldersey and Molly Goodman, have praised her for inspiring them and their performance.

articles.summary: Olympic swimmer Caeleb Dressel has criticised World Aquatics' handling of a Chinese doping case, expressing lack of confidence in the organisation's handling of the case. Dressel, who has won five golds at the Tokyo Olympics and is one of the most decorated swimmers in Paris, stated he was not confident in the level playing field at the Paris Games. The case began in April when 23 Chinese swimmers tested positive for a banned heart medication at a training camp in 2021 but still competed at the 2020 Tokyo Olympics. An independent investigation this month ruled the World Anti-Doping agency WADA did not mishandle or show favouritism to China, while a World Aquatic audit concluded there was no mismanagement or cover-up by the governing body.

articles.summary: Former mountain bike world champion Evie Richards overcame a concussion scare before her second Olympic appearance in Paris 2024. Despite initially believing there was no serious damage to her bike, Richards, who had previously suffered a concussion while on Grant Ferguson's training camp for the 2016 Olympics, found out about the concussion after a World Cup race in Araxa, Brazil in April. She returned to racing at the British nationals in early June and was selected for her second Olympics in June. Since returning to racing, Richards has had a podium finish with fifth place at the Crans-Montana World Cup and sixth place in Les Gets. She credits her success to her Olympic debut in Tokyo and subsequent victories in Val di Sole.

The announcement of LeBron James as the male flag bearer for Team USA was criticized by women's sports activist Riley Gaines, who argued that he should have been disqualified due to his controversial stance on the American anthem-kneeling movement. Gaines also highlighted that James was one of the most prominent anthem-knowerers in the liberal activist movement after Colin Kaepernick's rise. James, who was previously criticized for his knee-bowing, has also stated that he will no longer root for his favorite football team, the Dallas Cowboys, in 2022 due to their owner's insistence on standing for the national anthem.

She credits her career to creating a high-performance shoe brand that was designed specifically for women's feet. Despite initially being offered only 30% of her previous earnings, she chose to stay with Nike due to its commitment to supporting female athletes during pregnancy. Nike responded by stating that it has always taken great pride as a leader in helping female athletes and supporting women as they navigate their careers in sports.

articles.summary: British athlete Linford Christie tested positive for the banned stimulant pseudoephedrine during the 1988 Seoul Olympics, claiming he had inadvertently taken it when drinking ginseng tea. Christie, who had already won the silver medal in the 100m, was awarded the gold medal after Canada's Ben Johnson was disqualified due to a positive drugs test. Despite defending himself before a medical commission of the International Olympic Committee, Christie was given the "benefit of the doubt" by an 11-10 vote. His career was also marred by a lifetime ban from the British Olympic Association. In 1999, despite initially clearing for nandrolone, the IAAF imposed a two-year ban on Christie.

articles.summary: The company in charge of redevelopment work at the Kanjuruhan Stadium in Indonesia has apologised to victims' families after demolishing one of the gates that was intended to be retained as a memorial. Gate 13, where a large proportion of the victims died, was knocked down last month despite assurances from officials that it would remain untouched. The company has stated it will rebuild the new wall according to its original specifications and bricks have been prepared for reconstruction at the site. Protests and legal action against the demolition continued despite families being prevented from getting close to the site and other locations where people died. The tragedy, which claimed 135 lives and injured 700 people, was the worst stadium tragedy for 62 years.

articles.summary: Swiss running brand On has launched a spray-on marathon shoe, "LightSpray", produced by a robotic arm to create a sock-like upper without laces. This move comes as On, a brand founded in 2010 and listed in New York in 2021, attempts to compete with market leaders Nike and Adidas in the high-tech running shoe contest. The production method, which uses fewer parts per pair, challenges the current footwear manufacturing model which involves shipping finished shoes from factories in Asia to shoppers in the U.S. and Europe. The midsole, foam and plate of the LightSpray shoe are currently produced in Asia, but On plans to manufacture these elements in Switzerland eventually. At $330, On's shoe is at the upper end of the market, less expensive than Adidas' $500 model.

articles.summary: Paris is set to host its first Olympic Games in a century, with a grand opening ceremony and 16 days of competition. The most extravagant and elaborate Olympic opening ever, a gala on the River Seine, will kick off the event with nearly equal numbers of men and women. The French capital hopes this will revitalize the Olympics' legacy after two disappointing Olympics. However, security challenges include past and present attacks on athletes and millions of visitors. The Games aim to be less polluting, more sustainable and more socially virtuous than their predecessors. Many of the sports venues are temporary, as Paris didn't want to repeat the mistake of previous Olympic host cities. The opening ceremony will showcase France, its people and history, and the iconic Eiffel Tower.

articles.summary: The Paris Olympics are set to begin with themes of peace, understanding, and improvements to the human condition. The ancient games, begun in 776 B.C., required a truce in all intercity conflicts in Greece and guaranteed safe travel for all going to Olympia. The Greek emphasis on developing both mind and body extended to two of the greatest education centers of all time, the Academy of Plato and the Lyceum of Aristotle. The modern Olympics began as part of the World's Fair mania of the late 19th century, but the peace ideal was a minor theme. Today, there are numerous Olympic-themed leadership programs that purportedly work for peace. Silvio Laccetti suggests that a change in funding could be made for the Olympians for Peace, a new kind of Olympian chosen from selected and self-selected Olympians.

This would be the first public performance since 2019 for Dion, who has been receiving treatment for the rare neurological condition Stiff Person Syndrome. French President Emmanuel Macron did not specify what the ceremony director Thomas Jolly was planning, but admitted there was also a surprise.

This comes after Dallas Cowboys owner Jerry Jones went to court in Texarkana for a paternity case he has been fighting for two years. The training camp also marks the return of running back Ezekiel Elliott, who was released by the team last March due to a disagreement over a reworked contract. This marks the 45th year the team has trained in Southern California and the 18th season they have spent camp at the Oxnard location.

articles.title: Macron touts Paris summit tying sports and sustainability during Olympics
articles.description: An international summit meant to bolster support for sport initiatives that accelerate sustainable development is to be held in Paris a day before the Olympic Games officially open. About 500 participants, including 50 heads of state and government, are expected to attend the summit Thursday championed by French President Emmanuel Macron and International Olympic Committee President Thomas Bach. Macron's office said financial commitments for sports and sustainability initiatives are expected to be made at the summit. The event is also meant to underline the importance the Olympics give to climate-related commitments.

articles.description: in one of the hottest video games on the planet. EA Sports College Football 25 released on Friday as schools across the country threw parties, tournaments and fan events with their teams to celebrate. Florida gave The Associated Press a behind-the-scenes look this week at teammates squaring off on a big screen during the team's annual photo shoot. Freshman quarterback DJ Lagway grabbed a controller, settled comfortably into a leather stool and immediately started to adjust Florida's roster. There was only one move to make. Lagway benched Graham Mertz and inserted himself into the lineup.

articles.summary: New EA Sports video game, College Football 25, has become a reality-based experience for college football players across the country. The game, which was released after an 11-year hiatus, allows players to be paid for their likeness and performance in one of the hottest video games on the planet. The release of EA Sports' college football game was celebrated by schools across the US and beyond. Players, including freshman quarterback DJ Lagway, and freshman linebacker Myles Graham, grew up playing Madden, the game's NFL equivalent. Despite the absence of previous games for 11 years, EA Sports decided to revive its revered game after the NCAA allowed college athletes to profit from their brand. Players offered to be featured in the game for a minimum of $600 and a copy of the game, including all Florida's roster.

articles.summary: The 2024 Paris Olympics tennis draw has set up a potential match between Novak Djokovic and Rafael Nadal, two of the best tennis players ever. If both players win their opening-round matches, the potential match could take place at Roland-Garros Stadium. Nadal has won the French Open 14 times and Djokvic has three French Open titles. Great Britain's Andy Murray, the 2012 and 2016 Olympic gold medalist, withdrew from the singles competition due to injury. In the women's draw, world No. 2 Coco Gauff will play against Australia’s Ajla Tomljanovic and Iga Swiatek of Poland will play Romania's Irina-Camelia Begu.
